description: Responsible for developing Banca Finint business activities in Rome and Center-South of Italy. Banca Finint is part of Finanziaria Internazionale Group, which operates through the Finint brand, a privately held diversified group with more than 500 employees active also in the Business Process Outsourcing and with an important investment portfolio including inter alias a majority stake in Save (the company operating the Venice airport), and a participation in Generali. After 35 years of activity, in December 2015, Finanziaria Internazionale founded Banca Finint by purchasing Banca Arner licence. Banca Finint has more than 200 employees and is active in the Corporate Finace, Securitisation, Securitisation Servicing, DCM - with a particular focus on Minibonds issue -, Private Equity and operates one of the most innovative SGR in Italy.The latter manages funds in several fields (Real Estate, Illiquid Credit Funds, Fixed Income, Equity, Minibonds, Energy, etc.) with AUM in excess of €1 bln.

description: Responsible for developing Banca Finint business activities in Rome and Center-South of Italy. Banca Finint is part of Finanziaria Internazionale Group, which operates through the Finint brand, a privately held diversified group with more than 500 employees active also in the Business Process Outsourcing and with an important investment portfolio including inter alias a majority stake in Save (the company operating the Venice airport), and a participation in Generali. After 35 years of activity, in December 2015, Finanziaria Internazionale founded Banca Finint by purchasing Banca Arner licence. Banca Finint has more than 200 employees and is active in the Corporate Finace, Securitisation, Securitisation Servicing, DCM - with a particular focus on Minibonds issue -, Private Equity and operates one of the most innovative SGR in Italy.The latter manages funds in several fields (Real Estate, Illiquid Credit Funds, Fixed Income, Equity, Minibonds, Energy, etc.) with AUM in excess of €1 bln.

description: Impiegato nei sistemi informativi con compiti di gestione ed organizzazione dei flussi della supply chain aziendale e di analisi dei processi di importazione e distribuzione del prodotto finito. Mansioni svolti grazie all’implementazione e al controllo del WMS (Warehouse Management System) e di tutti i sistemi che dipendono e/o interagiscono con esso: gestionale aziendale (Stealth – AS400), pacchetto costi (NetMover), pacchetti di gestione import (Supply Web) ed export (Web Packing List). Sviluppo e coordinamento di SQL Server 2005, che rappresenta il database di appoggio dell’intera piattaforma WMS, e progettazione dei collegamenti con applicativi specifici per l’archiviazione di dati come database relazionali, per l’estrazione e l’analisi degli stessi con strumenti di tipo OLAP (On-Line Analytical Processing) come Crystal Report. Facente parte integrante del progetto legato alla realizzazione del nuovo centro distributivo con compiti di analisi dei flussi logistici (import-picking-replenishment-sorting-shipping) e di coordinamento delle implementazioni informatiche con le esigenze di processo.

description: Novaskill is not-for-profit training company, originally established in 1980 as a group training organisation focused on the supply of apprentices and trainees in the Newcastle area; Novaskill are now also a fully accredited Registered Training Organisation providing training across a broad range of occupations and industries tailored to the needs of individual enterprises to the broader requirements of a region or industry throughout New South Wales and Queensland. Branch Coordinator Achievements: * Promotion from Senior RTO Training Consultant to Branch Coordinator within two months of employment after exceeding budgetary outcomes and key performance indicators each month * Creation of strong working relations through interpersonal communication and business development foundations with key stakeholders to ensure business unit maintain front of mind exposure * Development of strategic partnerships through training to ensure full capacity of branch and exceeding of budget each month running * Built sales, field officer and trainer teams, from recruitment and development through to becoming the leaders amongst the NSW & QLD branches in the achievement of key performance indicators each week * Further development of my knowledge of adult learning principles and their application to external business units * Development of tailored training packages for SME’s blending nationally accredited training activities and soft skills to achieve customer requirements and ensure new partnerships are built on * Development of tools and techniques to ensure 90% retention of class sizes for all branch courses * Reduction of 30, 60 and 90 days debtors to 2.5% from 8%

description: JIMACO is the parent company of Internationally branded Showcase Jewellers, Gemtime and United Jewellery Buyers, together forming the strongest group of independently owned retail jewellery stores located in all key urban and rural centre's across Australia and New Zealand. The Group provides expertise and support the 270 plus members' stores in all aspects of retailing, from training through to specialist assistance in marketing, financial and trade matters. Operations and Business Development Manager (Australia and New Zealand) Responsibilities: * Drive key service relationships with operational units in order to support company direction / growth. * Relationship development with key lease holders, negotiation support and guidance in property lease management and associated legal issues. * Delivery of membership services ensuring appropriate policies and procedures are in place to support the direction of the Company. * Development of change management strategy and working in a collaborative manner to deliver outcomes at a management level on all aspects of franchise operations. * Management and coordination of the branch network vital to the ongoing development and growth of the organization build and grow on current sales, open new stores nationally and internationally, refurbish existing stores. * Develop, implement and evaluate Work Health and Safety policies and programs to ensure safe and healthy working conditions. * Monitor and assist Membership with the application of all state and federal legislation including but not limited to Industrial Relations, Anti-discrimination, Occupational Health and Safety, Trade Practices and Privacy. * Administration of the ‘Tickit’ Compliance System, in line with AS/NZS4360 Risk Management and AS/NZS3806 Compliance standards. * Production of on-demand and strategic market research reports to the benefit of Showcase / JIMACO. * Administration of the Microsoft Exchange Server.

description: The Western Union Company has become an industry leader in global money transfer with over 365,000 Agent locations in more than 200 countries and territories. From the roots of our signature telegram business, we expanded and evolved our services in 1871 to offer electronic money transfer. Today, Western Union offers money order, money transfer, payment and prepaid services. In Australia, Western Union has over 16 Network Agents, and 5000+ Agents providing the service. Achievements: Advised Network Agents on relationship building between Network Agent and Sub Agent, How to achieve Customer Satisfaction for the End User and on the new requirements under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorism Financing Act Cth 2006, monitoring risk and providing direction to achieve compliance through operational change: * Revision of Credit Control policy to enable better relationships between Network Agent and Sub Agent and to ensure the Western Union product was available without restriction * Revision of account and password controls for mobilisation of operators across Sub Agents incorporating Agentlink (an operational web based Network management tool) * Provide training solutions directed at compliance and fraud prevention directly to the network * Overhaul of the Energise Training program – a web based training platform. The website aims to train over 2000 Front Line Associates in all aspects of the Western Union service including Compliance, Customer Service, Fraud Prevention, Safety and Security. * Auditing of top 600 Sub Agent: carried out in an emergency response to changes in regulations and were completed within three months; on location and covering quality customer service standards, compliance policies and procedures, the Sub Agent compliance officer role, fraud prevention, and safety and security * Advisor for the Compliance Report 2007 and 2008 to the 5000+ network of agents in order to maintain a compliant uniform product.

description: Finint is the largest Western Union Master Agent in Europe and the fourth largest in the World, having established itself as a market leader in 1995. The Finint UK Ltd branch has seen extraordinary growth since its establishment in January 2007, with a network of subagents equal to that of its long term competitors. Achievements: Sole development of the UK Training and Support Manager role and the Support Team within a fast paced and newly established business environment (first 2 Months) covering: * The development of job descriptions, hiring of personnel, allocation of resources, training and people management * The design of Sub Agent Set Up Training covering Systems, Customer Service Standards, Security and Compliance * The design of an in-house operations manual covering all Finint policies and procedures * Strong written and verbal communication skills in order to lead and work with teams across several European countries, including Spain and Italy, as well as the USA * Redesign of the Finint Italy (mother company) policies and procedures to suit a newly established and developing company in the United Kingdom business and legal environment * Addressing with the Information and Technology team the need to redesign the Point of Sale System to suit the needs of the United Kingdom Sub Agent rather than continue with the Italian version * Successful representation of the company in legal proceedings against bad debtors and fraud cases * Investigation of high value fraud cases, and the impact of them on the business financials * Conducting regular performance reviews, reallocation of resources to the right position in a changing business environment in order to achieve financial goals * Contact for WU US/UK Security Team to establish a minimum standard in fraud prevention and handling

description: Ho realizzato lo start-up della società che si occupa della distribuzione di prodotti di finanziamento ed assicurativi (mutui, prestiti personali, CQS, Delegazioni, polizze RC, CPI) per famiglie e PMI operando con i principali partner bancari e assicurativi : Unicredit, Banco Popolare, Cariparma, Carispezia, Friuladria, BNL, BNL Finance, Compass, Futuro, Itas Mutua, Net Insurance, MPS, Antonveneta, CheBanca!, Ing, Pianifico la strategia organizzativa a B/M/L termine prevalentemente con riferimento ai target di fatturato da raggiungere e al reperimento delle risorse necessarie al fine di potenziare la politica commerciale, ottimizzare i piani di espansione del business, identificare eventuali scostamenti degli obiettivi assegnati ed implementare azioni correttive adeguate. Sono responsabile della supervisione di 10 risorse interne, 9 consulenze esterne e circa 300 agenti monomandatari, coordinandone le attività e promuovendone la motivazione e lo sviluppo professionale. Mi preme sottolineare di essere riuscito a posizionare Auxilia quale seconda realtà nel mercato di riferimento e di aver conseguito con la mia governace societaria, l’utile di bilancio nel 2011 e nel 2012 in un contesto di mercato sfavorevole per il credito alle famiglie e alle PMI in seguito all’entrata in vigore del Dlgs 141/2010.
